unnormalised: Hey everyone, let's talk trash! Waste management in India is a HUGE issue, right? From overflowing landfills in Delhi to the mountains of garbage near Bengaluru, it's something we see every day.
normalised: Hey everyone, let's talk trash! Waste management in India is a huge issue, right? From overflowing landfills in Delhi to the mountains of garbage near Bengaluru, it's something we see every day.

unnormalised: But it's not all doom and gloom! The Swachh Bharat Abhiyan is pushing for change, and we're seeing some amazing initiatives. Take, for example, the community in Pune using bio-enzymes to break down organic waste – talk about desi innovation!
normalised: But it's not all doom and gloom! The S W A C H H Bharat Abhiyan is pushing for change, and we're seeing some amazing initiatives. Take, for example, the community in Pune using bio-enzymes to break down organic waste – talk about desi innovation!

unnormalised: The IIT Madras is also doing some cool research on converting plastic waste into fuel – maybe we can finally get rid of those mountains someday!
normalised: The I I T Madras is also doing some cool research on converting plastic waste into fuel – maybe we can finally get rid of those mountains someday!

unnormalised: Challenges still remain, of course. Getting everyone on board for proper segregation, ensuring efficient collection systems (especially in crowded cities like Mumbai), and implementing strict regulations for industrial waste disposal are key. Remember that incident back in 2018, 23/04/2018, near the Ganga? Let’s learn from those mistakes.
normalised: Challenges still remain, of course. Getting everyone on board for proper segregation, ensuring efficient collection systems (especially in crowded cities like Mumbai), and implementing strict regulations for industrial waste disposal are key. Remember that incident back in two thousand and eighteen, twenty third april two thousand and eighteen, near the Ganga? Let’s learn from those mistakes.

unnormalised: The next review meeting for the local waste management program is scheduled for 10/10/2024 at 14:00 hrs in the Municipal Corporation office. Hopefully, they'll have some good news.
normalised: The next review meeting for the local waste management program is scheduled for tenth october two thousand and twenty four at two P M in the Municipal Corporation office. Hopefully, they'll have some good news.

unnormalised: Also, many local NGOs are conducting awareness drives every Sunday at 09:00 hrs - join them and be a part of the solution! It's our Bharat, and we need to keep it clean, right? We've come too far since 15/08/1947 to let waste take over!
normalised: Also, many local N G O S are conducting awareness drives every Sunday at nine A M - join them and be a part of the solution! It's our Bharat, and we need to keep it clean, right? We've come too far since fifteenth august nineteen forty seven to let waste take over!
